intro: Diplacus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and canyon walls. It has broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces seeds in capsule-like structures. Diplacus latifolius is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
